article.headline: TCU 79, Wyoming 78
article.story: FORT WORTH, Texas -- Edvinas Ruzgas hit a 3-pointer with 19 seconds left in overtime and Kevin Langford blocked a a last-second layup to give TCU a 79-78 win over Wyoming Wednesday night. Langford scored 36 points to lead TCU (13-6, 4-1 Mountain West), which led throughout much of the game. Brandon Ewing tied it at 66-66 with 2:41 left on a free throw and Wyoming sent the game into overtime on Tyson Johnson's 3-pointer that tied it at 72-72 with 13 seconds left in regulation. TCU's Ronnie Moss missed a 3-pointer as time expired. Ronnie Moss added 11 points for TCU and Zvonko Buljan added 10. Johnson and Sean Ogirri each scored 18 for Wyoming. Ewing added 16 and Afam Muojeke contributed 12 for Wyoming (12-6, MWC 1-3). Adam Waddell hit 10.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
